item.title: Corporate India is facing challenges in recruiting women candidates for job positions
item.description:
MyParichay, a Facebook-based recruiting platform, states that social recruiting is no longer optional. They report that 90% of recruiters believe a social media-based hiring tool would offer a competitive edge in hiring a gender-diverse workforce. Source: MyParichay A company-wide survey in India conducted by MyParichay revealed that 85% of companies surveyed believe diversity is critical for workplace innovation. However, MyParichay found that 75% of recruiters struggle to find qualified female candidates to meet the gender diversity goals set by leadership...

item.title: The Commission's Proposal on gender quotas in corporate boards suggests a 40% representation of Venus and 60% representation of Mars.
item.description:
Juan Carlos Benito Sánchez, LL.M. Candidate at KU Leuven — Twitter @jcbensan The European Union faces a significant gender diversity challenge in its top corporate leadership positions. Although more than half of European university graduates are women, they remain underrepresented on company boards. Men outnumber women nearly four to one in these positions, with significant disparities among member states, ranging from under five percent female representation to over thirty percent...
